Accès rapide

Recherche par intervenant
Recherche par intervenant
Lundi 17 Novembre 2016
Gretty Mirdal (directrice de l'IEA de Paris) Juan Perez (University Valencia) Saadi Lahlou (London School of Economics) Introduction Charlan Nemeth (University of California, Berkeley) The legacy of Serge Moscovici Stamos Papastamou (Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences) The discrete charm of the genetic model of influence and its indirect impact on epistemic level Carlo Michael Sommer (Darmstadt University of Applied Sciences) Minority Influence and Fashion. The Model of Style Transformation Amber M. Gaffney (Humboldt State University) Jiin Jung, William D. Crano, and Michael A. Hogg (Claremont Graduate University) Contexts and Conditions of Outgroup Influence Fanny Lalot, Juan Manuel Falomir-Pichastor and Alain Quiamzade (University of Geneva) The impact of majority and minority social support for pro-environmental values on pro-environmental behaviours Timothy B. Hayes and Wendy Wood (University of Southern California) Minorities, Meanings, and the Structure of Group Influence: Reflecting and Building Upon the Theoretical Contributions of Serge Moscovici Bernard Personnaz (Centre Edgar Morin IIAC EHESS-CNRS) Psychologie sociale et recherches sur l’influence minoritaire Kamilla Khamzina, Elodie Roebroeck and Serge Guimond (Laboratoire de Psychologie Sociale et Cognitive, Blaise Pascal University, Clermont-Ferrand) Connecting social representation research with minority influence Andreea Ernst-Vintila (Paris-Ouest-Nanterre-la-Défense University) Yechiel Klar (Tel Aviv University) Is There a Social Psychology of Historic Grievances and Intergroup Conflict in the Age of ‘Radicalisation’? Marie Personnaz (Paris-Ouest-Nanterre-la-Défense University - Centre Edgar Morin IIAC EHESS-CNRS) De la polarisation à la radicalisation Babette Gekeler (Institute for Medical Psychology, Charité University Hospitals, Berlin) Kathrin Friederici (Humboldt University, Berlin) Understanding Complexity in Social Engagement with Multiculturalism: why a Multimethod Approach is needed to unravel the Contention with ‘Differences’ Jorge Correia Jesuino (Instituto Superior de Ciências Sociais e Políticas (ISCSP), University of Lisbon) To a semiotic approach to Serge Moscovici’s thinking
Mardi 18 Novembre 2016
Dorra Ben Alaya (Tunis El Manar University) For a «psychology of our «culture» Sabine Caillaud (Paris-Descartes University) How «human history of nature» and the theory of minorities shed light on the dialogical part of social representations. The case of psychologists addressing ecological issues Inari Sakki, Rusten Menard and EEmeli Hakoköngäs Sakki (University of Helsinki) The formation processes re-visited – the importance of naturalized representations Gina Philogene (Sarah Lawrence College, New York) The Invention of Society and the Isolation of Social Psychology Juliet Foster (University of Cambridge) Society and Theory in Social Psychology: a reconsideration Fabrice Buschini (Sorbonne Nouvelle - Paris 3 University) Diffusion, propagation, propagande : et après ? L’effusion, un nouveau mode de communication médiatique pour l’étude des représentations sociales
Mardi 18 Novembre 2016 (Session publique)
George Gaskel (London School of Economics) What and why questions in social representations: securing Moscovici’s legacy John Rijsman (University of Tilburg) Experimental social psychology is not a science of discovery, but an art of theatrical reflection Saadi Lahlou (London School of Economics) Future issues. The analysis of behaviour Themis Apostolidis (University of Aix-Marseille) Future issues: Methods and themes Nikos Kalampalikis (Lumière Lyon 2 University) Future issues: On forms of social thinking Juan A. Pérez (University of Valencia) Future isues: Active minorities vs. Victimized minorities: An Unfinished Task Denise Jodelet (EHESS) Future issues. Applications of Social representations to education and health
Recherche par titre
Lundi 17 Novembre 2016

EASP 2016 - Programme et vidéos
La version pdf du programme de l'EASP 2016 est disponible ici.

Jeudi 11 Novembre 2016

Introduction

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 10:30
Gretty Mirdal (directrice de l'IEA de Paris)
Juan Perez (University Valencia)
Saadi Lahlou (London School of Economics)

The legacy of Serge Moscovici

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 10:45
Charlan Nemeth (University of California, Berkeley)

The discrete charm of the genetic model of influence and its indirect impact on epistemic level

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 11:05
Stamos Papastamou (Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences)

Minority Influence and Fashion. The Model of Style Transformation

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 11:25
Carlo Michael Sommer (Darmstadt University of Applied Sciences)

Contexts and Conditions of Outgroup Influence

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 12:40
Amber M. Gaffney (Humboldt State University)
Jiin Jung, William D. Crano, and Michael A. Hogg (Claremont Graduate University)

The impact of majority and minority social support for pro-environmental values on pro-environmental behaviours

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 13:00
Fanny Lalot, Juan Manuel Falomir-Pichastor and Alain Quiamzade (University of Geneva)

Minorities, Meanings, and the Structure of Group Influence: Reflecting and Building Upon the Theoretical Contributions of Serge Moscovici

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 13:20
Timothy B. Hayes and Wendy Wood (University of Southern California)

Psychologie sociale et recherches sur l’influence minoritaire

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 15:15
Bernard Personnaz (Centre Edgar Morin IIAC EHESS-CNRS)

Connecting social representation research with minority influence

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 15:55
Kamilla Khamzina, Elodie Roebroeck and Serge Guimond (Laboratoire de Psychologie Sociale et Cognitive, Blaise Pascal University, Clermont-Ferrand)

Is There a Social Psychology of Historic Grievances and Intergroup Conflict in the Age of ‘Radicalisation’?

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 17:10
Andreea Ernst-Vintila (Paris-Ouest-Nanterre-la-Défense University)
Yechiel Klar (Tel Aviv University)

De la polarisation à la radicalisation

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 17:30
Marie Personnaz (Paris-Ouest-Nanterre-la-Défense University - Centre Edgar Morin IIAC EHESS-CNRS)

Understanding Complexity in Social Engagement with Multiculturalism: why a Multimethod Approach is needed to unravel the Contention with ‘Differences’

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 17:50
Babette Gekeler (Institute for Medical Psychology, Charité University Hospitals, Berlin)
Kathrin Friederici (Humboldt University, Berlin)

To a semiotic approach to Serge Moscovici’s thinking

Le 17 novembre 2016 à 18:45
Jorge Correia Jesuino (Instituto Superior de Ciências Sociais e Políticas (ISCSP), University of Lisbon)

Vendredi 18 Novembre 2016

For a «psychology of our «culture»

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 10:45
Dorra Ben Alaya (Tunis El Manar University)

How «human history of nature» and the theory of minorities shed light on the dialogical part of social representations. The case of psychologists addressing ecological issues

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 11:05
Sabine Caillaud (Paris-Descartes University)

The formation processes re-visited – the importance of naturalized representations

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 11:25
Inari Sakki, Rusten Menard and EEmeli Hakoköngäs Sakki (University of Helsinki)

The Invention of Society and the Isolation of Social Psychology

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 12:40
Gina Philogene (Sarah Lawrence College, New York)

Society and Theory in Social Psychology: a reconsideration

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 13:00
Juliet Foster (University of Cambridge)

Diffusion, propagation, propagande : et après ? L’effusion, un nouveau mode de communication médiatique pour l’étude des représentations sociales

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 13:20
Fabrice Buschini (Sorbonne Nouvelle - Paris 3 University)

Future directions for a societal psychology
Public session

What and why questions in social representations: securing Moscovici’s legacy

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 15:15
George Gaskel (London School of Economics)

Experimental social psychology is not a science of discovery, but an art of theatrical reflection

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 15:35
John Rijsman (University of Tilburg)

Future issues. The analysis of behaviour

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 15:55
Saadi Lahlou (London School of Economics)

Future issues: Methods and themes

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 16:15
Themis Apostolidis (University of Aix-Marseille)

Future issues: On forms of social thinking

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 17:10
Nikos Kalampalikis (Lumière Lyon 2 University)

Future isues: Active minorities vs. Victimized minorities: An Unfinished Task

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 17:10
Juan A. Pérez (University of Valencia)

Future issues. Applications of Social representations to education and health

Le 18 novembre 2016 à 17:50
Denise Jodelet (EHESS)
